newsitem.title: FRANCE: DFS will slightly dilute LVMH 1996 net.
newsitem.headline: DFS will slightly dilute LVMH 1996 net.

text.p: French luxury goods group LVMH said on Friday that the acquisition of the U.S. DFS company would have a slightly dilutive effect on its net results but would be strongly positive at the net operating level, before exceptionals and goodwill writedown.
It said in a statement that talks with Robert Miller, a minority holder of Duty Free Shoppers (DFS), could end soon and on terms close to LVMH's original acquisition of DFS stock.
It added that 1996 provisional, attributable, net operating profit should be up about six percent versus 1995. pnt

"The group confirms that the impact on the 96 results from DFS on the profroma accounts of LVMH should be strongly positive at the net operating level (before exceptional elements and writedown of goodwill) and very slightly dilutive on the net result," LVMH said in a statement.
As previously indicated, the proforma integration of DFS in 1996 would have led to a significant increase in cashflow.

"The LVMH group moreover (expects) the negotiations with Mr Robert Miller for the acquisition of his holding in DFS could be concluded soon on conditions close to those for the purchases already made," it said.
"LVMH also announces that its provisional net attributable operating result shows a rise of about six percent compared to 1995."
